clinical_study.brief_title: Framing of Numerical Information in Cochrane Summaries
clinical_study.official_title: Framing of Numerical Information in Cochrane Summaries: a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Split, School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: University of Split, School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to conduct three different parallel randomized controlled trials to assess how the different framing of Cochrane summary information (positive vs negative framing of health information) affects affect the perception of the efficacy and intention for use of the described treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the study was to conduct three different parallel randomized controlled trials to assess how the different framing of Cochrane summary information (positive vs negative framing of health information) affects affect the perception of the efficacy and intention for use of the described treatment.

primary_outcome.description: One item on Likert type scale from 1-10, higher score indicates the higher perceived effectiveness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Desire to use the described treatment
secondary_outcome.description: One item on Likert type scale from 1-10, higher score indicates the greater desire to use the described treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Desire that treatment is prescribed by family doctor
secondary_outcome.description: One item on Likert type scale from 1-10. Higher score indicates the greater desire that treatment is prescribed by family doctor.

arm_group.description: The numerical expressions were presented in a positive way: e.g. treatment was successful for 4 out of 10 persons.
The numerical expressions were presented in a negative way: e.g. treatment was unsuccessful for 6 out of 10 persons.

intervention.description: Each group received only one frame of information.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First year medical students
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those who have failed first year and have to repeat it.
